summary: Email correspondence between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and defense counsel regarding logistical arrangements for delivering discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). The defense requests permission to hand-deliver a drive containing discovery to Maxwell over the weekend.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated defendant who is unable to view previously provided discovery materials on a CD and needs a new drive to review them over the weekend.

events.title: Discovery Delivery Request
events.description: Defense counsel requests permission to hand-deliver a new drive containing discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC to allow her to review them over the weekend, as the U.S. Attorney's Office is unavailable to deliver it.

locations: U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was unable to view discovery materials previously provided on a CD, necessitating a new drive.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was preparing a new drive with the discovery material for Maxwell.
Defense counsel offered to pick up the drive from the U.S. Attorney's Office and hand-deliver it to Maxwell at the MDC to facilitate weekend review.
The correspondence highlights logistical challenges in providing discovery to an incarcerated defendant.
The email chain dates to January 2021, during Maxwell's pre-trial detention.
